analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na / skyes bu rmi lam rmis pas rmi lam gyi rang bzhin bshad pa bstan kyang rmi lam gyi rang bzhin bstan pa med do //
translated: Although a person in a dream teaches the nature of a dream, the nature of a dream is not taught.

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rmi lam nyid kyang med na /

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /

analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin ston kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gang yang med do //
translated: in the same way, although the nature of the perfection of wisdom is taught, there is no nature of the perfection of wisdom at all.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / rmi lam ni /

analyzed: chos gang bstan par yang nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi @42a *//

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mthong ba'i skyes bu sgyu ma'i rang bzhin bshad pa ston kyang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gang yang med na /
translated: for example, although a person who sees an illusion teaches the nature of the illusion, there is no nature of the illusion at all.

analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid lta ga la yod /

analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa gang yang med do //

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /

analyzed: dper na / brag ca'i spyod yul la gnas pa'i skyes bus brag ca'i sgra thos kyi /

analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i tshig thos par 'gyur yang chos gang bstan pa thos par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: In the same way, although the words that teach the perfection of wisdom are heard, there is no dharma that is taught that is heard.

analyzed: gzhan du na nam mngon par bshad pa de'i ste kun shes shing /

analyzed: thos pa'i lam du 'gyur ro //

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

translated: for example, a person who sees a bubble may point out the nature of a bubble, but the nature of a bubble is not perceived either internally or externally.

original: rab kyi rtsal @43a *//
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal @43a *//
translated: How could the nature of that which is being pointed out be perceived?

original: gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: gyis rnam par gnon pa /

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin yang mi dmigs so //
translated: in the same way, even though the perfection of wisdom is pointed out, the nature of the perfection of wisdom is not perceived.🔽Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa; 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / lbu ba rdos pa de ni /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa; 'di lta ste / dper na / lbu ba rdos pa de ni /

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

analyzed: chu'i chu bur gyi rang bzhin bstan pa lta ga la yod /

analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /

translated: in the same way, the perfection of wisdom is shown, and yet the nature of the perfection of wisdom does not exist.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na / chu'i chu bur ni /

translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang chos gang mngon par 'grub par 'gyur bar nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom does not stand as something that can be accomplished.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: because birth is not fully accomplished,🔽and because old age,

translated: The perfection of wisdom is not established because impermanence, suffering, no-self, peace, the distorting influences, obscurations, the elimination of views, accumulation, and close accumulation are not established.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not established because pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain are not established.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not established because arising, ceasing, abiding, and changing are not established.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not established because the aggregates, sense spheres, and senses-and-fields are not established.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin; sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub pa'o //🔽skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba yongs @45a *//

analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / nub pa dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa dang / slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes par byed pa dang / shes par byed du bcug pa yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub po //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not established because the origination, disappearance, self, sentient being, life, nourished being, human, person, human born of Manu, child of Manu, agent, instigator,🔽one who instigates, one who causes to instigate, one who feels, one who causes to feel, one who knows, and one who causes to know are not established.

translated: The perfection of wisdom is not established because truth, falsity, the conditioned, the unconditioned, going, not going, the visible, the invisible, the internal, and the external are not established.

translated: gathering, the characteristic of duality, and unborn.

original: pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / phung po thams cad nges par 'dor ba dang /
analyzed: pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / phung po thams cad nges par 'dor ba dang /
translated: non-formation,🔽śamatha, vipaśyanā, knowledge, liberation, exhaustion, freedom from desire, cessation, the definite relinquishment of all the aggregates,

original: 'byung ba dang / kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes dang / rang byung gi ye shes dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i ye shes dang /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes dang / rang byung gi ye shes dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i ye shes dang /
translated: the elements, the conventional, the ultimate, the levels of the hearers and solitary buddhas, the wisdom of omniscience, the wisdom of nonattachment, the wisdom of self-arising, and the wisdom that is equal to the unequaled.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad med par gtogs pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi ye shes dang / chos thams cad kyi ji lta ba bzhin bstan du med pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad med par gtogs pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi ye shes dang / chos thams cad kyi ji lta ba bzhin bstan du med pa dang /
translated: the bodhisattva vow, the saṅgha of śrāvakas, the perfection of pratyekabuddhas, the immeasurables, the wisdom of the Dharma that is unequaled, and the non-manifestation of all dharmas just as they are.

original: chos thams cad shes pa dang / mthong ba yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad shes pa dang / mthong ba yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is unestablished because the knowledge of all dharmas and the vision of all dharmas are unestablished.

original: bsil bar 'gyur pa dang / zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: bsil bar 'gyur pa dang / zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is unestablished because the attainment of coolness, peace, and complete peace is unestablished.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is unestablished because the ripening of beings is unestablished.

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su @46b ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub bo //
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su @46b ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub bo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not fully established because the thirty-two major marks of a great being are not fully established, because a pure buddhafield is not fully established, and because the ten powers of a buddha, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen special qualities of a buddha are not fully established.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub bo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub bo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not fully established because nirvāṇa is not fully established.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi bar du yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi bar du yongs su ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma grub ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not fully established because all wholesome and unwholesome dharmas are not fully established.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied extensively to everything.

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / nam mkha' ni /
translated: it is like this:🔽Space is

analyzed: gzugs med; bstan du med /

original: dngos po med de /
analyzed: dngos po med de /

analyzed: yongs su ma grub bo //

analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzugs med /

analyzed: dngos po med de /

analyzed: dper na / 'ja' ni /

analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bstan pa sna tshogs su nye bar gnas mod kyi /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' la sor mo lnga yongs su grub par sngon nam yang sus kyang ma mthong ngo //

analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /

analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin sngon nam yang sus kyang ma mthong ngo //
translated: in the same way, no one has ever seen the fully established nature of the perfection of wisdom.🔽“

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: khong du chud par dka' ba lags so //

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: gang mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa yongs su grub pa'i chos gang yang mi dmigs so //

original: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /

analyzed: rang bzhin ma mchis pa lags so //

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin med pas /
translated: because form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are without intrinsic nature,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin med do //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is without intrinsic nature.

original: khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rang bzhin med pas /
analyzed: khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rang bzhin med pas /
translated: Because the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination are without intrinsic nature,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is without intrinsic nature.

original: phyin ci log dang / sgrib pa dang / lta bar gyur pa dang / sred pa rnam par spyod pa rang bzhin med pas /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang / sgrib pa dang / lta bar gyur pa dang / sred pa rnam par spyod pa rang bzhin med pas /
translated: Because the errors, the obscurations, the views, and the conduct of craving are without intrinsic nature,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is without intrinsic nature.

original: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang /
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang /
translated: “Self,” “sentient being,” “life force,” “one who is nourished,” “person,” “individual,” “one born of strength,” “one endowed with strength,” “agent,” “one who causes action,” “one who feels,” “one who causes feeling,”

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do //

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa dang / chos kyi khams rang bzhin med pas; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa dang / chos kyi khams rang bzhin med pas; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do //
translated: the elements of earth, water, fire, wind, space, consciousness, and phenomena are essenceless.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams rang bzhin med pas /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams rang bzhin med pas /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is essenceless.

analyzed: tshul khrims dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / gnod sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / le lo dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes rab dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab rang bzhin med pas /
translated: wisdom and folly are essenceless.🔽Since the factors of awakening are essenceless,

translated: the perfection of wisdom is essenceless.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do; ;'phags pa'i bden pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / mngon par shes pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rang bzhin med pas /
translated: concentrations, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis are essenceless,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med do //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is essenceless.

translated: The perfection of wisdom is essenceless.

analyzed: zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa rang bzhin med pas /

analyzed: don dam pa shes pa bstan pa dang / kun rdzob rang bzhin med pas /

analyzed: bka' stsal pa /

translated: It is the profoundity of the compounded, the uncompounded, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, aging and death,

analyzed: na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa zab pas /
translated: sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and disturbance.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the five obscurations.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //🔽phyin ci log zab pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // phyin ci log zab pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the five inverted views.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the five aggregates.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the twelve sense bases.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the eighteen elements.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the four noble truths.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //🔽sgrib pa lnga zab pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // sgrib pa lnga zab pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the four concentrations.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the four immeasurables.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the four formless absorptions.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the five powers.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the five strengths.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //🔽lta ba zab pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // lta ba zab pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the seven branches of enlightenment.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the noble eightfold path.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the ten powers.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the four fearlessnesses.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //🔽bdag zab pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // bdag zab pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the four detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // @50b sems can zab pas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the knowledge of paths.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the knowledge of all bases.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the knowledge of all times.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the knowledge of the aspects of the bases.

original: spros pa zab pas /
analyzed: spros pa zab pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profoundity of the knowledge of the aspects of

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo /

translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: spros pa med pa zab pas /
analyzed: spros pa med pa zab pas /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // tshul khrims dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims zab pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound.🔽The perfection of wisdom is profound because morality and immorality are profound.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo /

translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dang /

translated: the path with its eight branches, suffering, origination, cessation, the path, and the knowledge and vision of liberation are profound.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid zab pas /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid zab pas /
translated: The past, the future, and the present are profound in their equality in the three times.🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profundity of the past, future, and present, and the equality of the three times.

original: mi 'jigs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang // mngon par shes pa zab pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //🔽'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes zab pas /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang // mngon par shes pa zab pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes zab pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profundity of the fearlessnesses, the bases of supernatural power, and the superknowledges.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profundity of the unobstructed knowledge of the past, future, and present.

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun zab pas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profundity of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su dag pas /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /

original: ma rig pa yongs su dag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: ma rig pa yongs su dag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: Because ignorance is pure, the perfection of wisdom is pure.

original: 'du byed yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su dag pa dang / ming dang gzugs yongs su dag pa dang / skye mched drug yongs su dag @53b pas; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: 'du byed yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su dag pa dang / ming dang gzugs yongs su dag pa dang / skye mched drug yongs su dag @53b pas; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is purified by the purification of contact,

original: reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba yongs su dag pas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba yongs su dag pas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, aging, sickness, and death.

original: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa yongs su dag pas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa yongs su dag pas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is purified by the purification of sorrow, lamentation, pain,🔽mental anguish, and disturbance.🔽The perfection of wisdom is purified by the purification of the perversions,

original: phyin ci log dang / sgrib pa dang / lta bar gyur pa yongs su dag pas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang / sgrib pa dang / lta bar gyur pa yongs su dag pas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: obscurations, and views.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yongs su dag pas /
translated: Because of the purity of desire, anger, and ignorance,🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because desire, hatred, and ignorance are pure.

original: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa dang /🔽slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang / mthong ba po yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang / mthong ba po yongs su dag pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because the self, sentient beings, life, nourished beings, humans, persons, those born of strength, strong ones, agents, instigators, feelers, and experiencers are pure.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /🔽chad pa dang / rtag pa yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go / chad pa dang / rtag pa yongs su dag pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because the one who sees, the one who instigates, and the one who arouses are pure.🔽The perfection of wisdom is pure because the one who sees is pure.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because annihilation and permanence are pure.

original: mtha' dang / mtha' med pa yongs su dag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /🔽sbyin pa yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: mtha' dang / mtha' med pa yongs su dag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go / sbyin pa yongs su dag pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because extremes and the absence of extremes are pure.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because generosity is pure.

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / @54a *//🔽shes rab yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / @54a *// shes rab yongs su dag pas /
translated: It is pure through the purity of discipline, patience, diligence, concentration,🔽and wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: It is pure through the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dbang bo dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: dbang bo dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su dag pas /
translated: It is pure through the purity of the faculties, powers, branches of awakening, concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: It is pure through the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms yongs su dag pas /
translated: It is pure through the purity of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: It is pure through the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba yongs su dag pas /
translated: It is pure through the purity of the applications of mindfulness and the correct exertions.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: It is pure through the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: phyin ci ma log pa yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa yongs su dag pas /
translated: It is pure through the purity of the absence of error.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: It is pure through the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yongs su dag pas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yongs su dag pas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is purified by the purity of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: mngon par shes pa yongs su dag pas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /🔽lam yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa yongs su dag pas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go / lam yongs su dag pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is purified by the purity of the superknowledges.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /🔽nyan thos kyi sa yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go / nyan thos kyi sa yongs su dag pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is purified by the purity of the path.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is purified by the purity of the śrāvaka level.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su dag pas; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /🔽sangs rgyas kyis yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su dag pas; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go / sangs rgyas kyis yongs su dag pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is purified by the purity of the pratyekabuddha level.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /🔽sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun @54b yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun @54b yongs su dag pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is purified by the purity of buddhahood.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is purified by the purity of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba yongs su dag pas /
translated: He has the pure vision of the wisdom of the past, future, and present.🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /🔽thogs pa med pa'i ye shes yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes yongs su dag pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because of the purity of the wisdom vision of the past, future, and present.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because of the purity of unobstructed wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su dag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /🔽'dod pa'i khams yongs su dag pa dang / gzugs kyi khams yongs su dag pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su dag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go / 'dod pa'i khams yongs su dag pa dang / gzugs kyi khams yongs su dag pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams yongs su dag pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because of the purity of the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /🔽sa'i khams yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go / sa'i khams yongs su dag pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because of the purity of the desire realm, the purity of the form realm, and the purity of the formless realm.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /🔽chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams yongs su dag pas /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because of the purity of the water, fire, and wind elements.

original: sems can gyi khams yongs su dag pa dang / chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa dang / nam mkha'i khams yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams yongs su dag pa dang / chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa dang / nam mkha'i khams yongs su dag pas /
translated: the realm of sentient beings is pure, the realm of phenomena is pure, and the realm of space is pure.🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because the realm of sentient beings is pure, because the realm of phenomena is pure, and because the realm of space is pure.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ra dva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ra dva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ngo mtshar lags so //

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag go /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is pure because space is pure.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rig par bya'o //

original: gang dag 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gang dag 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa lta ci smos te /

analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos la nges par lung bstan te /

original: gang dag tha na chos 'di la dad pa bskyed nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dun pa bskyed par 'gyur ba de dag gi lung bstan pa yang de nyid yin no //

translated: Those who, at the very least, arouse faith in this teaching and arouse the intention to achieve unsurpassed, perfect awakening will also receive that very prophecy.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: shin tu rnyed par dka' ste /

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di @59b gang dag gi rna lam du thos par 'gyur ba dang / thos nas klog pa dang / mos pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid bde ba chen po bskyed pa dang / phyir zhing nyan pa'i phyir chos 'di la 'dun pa bskyed pa'i sems can de dag kyang 'khor ba chen por zhugs par ngas ma bshad na /

translated: if I say that those sentient beings who will hear this perfection of wisdom with their ears, who will read it after hearing it, who will generate interest, who will generate joy, who will generate great mental satisfaction, and who will listen again and again and generate aspiration for this Dharma, will not enter great saṃsāra,

analyzed: ngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //

original: grub pa dang bde bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: grub pa dang bde bar 'dod pa /

original: sems can thams cad la bde bar sbyar bar nye bar gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu de dag gi nor chen po yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bde bar sbyar bar nye bar gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu de dag gi nor chen po yin no //
translated: those great bodhisattva beings who are established in the application of happiness for all beings are the great wealth.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: sems can chen po de dag ni; chos dkon mchog 'di tshol ba ste /
analyzed: sems can chen po de dag ni; chos dkon mchog 'di tshol ba ste /

original: 'di ni / de dag gi nor dam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / de dag gi nor dam pa'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: sems can bsod nams ma byas pa /🔽dman pa la mos pa /
analyzed: sems can bsod nams ma byas pa / dman pa la mos pa /

original: dad pa rab tu nyams pa rnams ni /
analyzed: dad pa rab tu nyams pa rnams ni /

original: chos kyi nor rgya chen po 'di la mos pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: chos kyi nor rgya chen po 'di la mos pa mi skye'o //

original: sh'a ri'i bu /🔽ngas de la dgongs te sems can dman pa la mos pa rnams kyang dman pa la mos pa dang / rgya chen po la mos pa rnams kyang rgya chen po la mos pa khams so sor sbyar ro //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu / ngas de la dgongs te sems can dman pa la mos pa rnams kyang dman pa la mos pa dang / rgya chen po la mos pa rnams kyang rgya chen po la mos pa khams so sor sbyar ro //
translated: Śāriputra,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: with that in mind, I have explained that those beings who are devoted to the inferior are devoted to the inferior, and those who are devoted to the vast are devoted to the vast.🔽I have applied the terms according to their individual dispositions.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul gang lags /

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Śāradvatī­putra as follows:

original: @60b sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: @60b sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: mtha' yas so //

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na / rlung gi khams kyi yul dang / spyod yul ni /

original: mtha' yas so //
analyzed: mtha' yas so //

original: 'di lta ste /

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: mtshan nyid med do //

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

analyzed: dper na; nam mkha'i khams dang / rlung gi khams ni /

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: mtshan nyid med pa'o //

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / nam mkha'i khams ni /

analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni /

analyzed: tha snyad kyi tshig @61b go /

analyzed: mtshan nyid med cing mtshan ma med de /

analyzed: de nyid mtshan nyid med par bstan to //

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu / chags pa med pa zhes bya ba de ni / chags pa yongs su shes pa'o; ;de ni /

original: chags pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chags pa mi dmigs so //

original: de ni / chags pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni / chags pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin no //

original: de ni / chags pa'i phyin ci ma log pa yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / chags pa'i phyin ci ma log pa yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: It is the thorough knowledge of the nonerroneous suchness of attachment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: chags pa la chags pa med de /
analyzed: chags pa la chags pa med de /

original: de'i phyir chags pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid dang / chags pa mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir chags pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid dang / chags pa mi dmigs pa ni /

original: chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are called nonattachment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: ye shes bstan pas /
analyzed: ye shes bstan pas /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This perfection of wisdom has the characteristic of nonattachment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /

original: chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de /

analyzed: chos gang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de mtshan nyid med pa ste /

analyzed: chos gang yang mtshan nyid mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //

original: gang la mtshan nyid med pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la mtshan nyid med pa de ni /

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called ‘without characteristic.’

original: gang mtshan nyid med pa de la chags pa med do //
analyzed: gang mtshan nyid med pa de la chags pa med do //
translated: That which is without characteristic is without attachment.

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings mtshan nyid cig yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings mtshan nyid cig yod na ni /
translated: If the dharmadhātu had a characteristic,

original: chos thams cad la chags par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: chos thams cad la chags par yang 'gyur na /

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad la mtshan nyid med pa de'i phyir de dag la chags pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad la mtshan nyid med pa de'i phyir de dag la chags pa med de /
translated: But because all dharmas are without characteristic, they are without attachment.

original: des na; chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: des na; chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, all dharmas are said to have the characteristic of nonattachment.

original: ji skad du brjod pa de bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa de bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not as it is expressed.

original: gang chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de ni /
analyzed: gang chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de ni /
translated: The characteristic of non-attachment is

original: brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: brjod par mi nus so //
translated: incapable of being expressed.

original: de ci'i phyir @62a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir @62a *//
translated: Why is that?

original: zhe na; med pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhe na; med pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Because of non-existence, the characteristic of non-attachment.

original: dben pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dben pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Because of isolation, the characteristic of non-attachment.

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Because of non-apprehension, the characteristic of non-attachment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: chos gang chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: chos gang chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gang yin pa de ni /
translated: whatever Dharma has the characteristic of non-attachment,

original: mthong ba cir yang nye bar gnas pa ma yin zhing mi mthong bar yang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mthong ba cir yang nye bar gnas pa ma yin zhing mi mthong bar yang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: that Dharma is not present as something seen or not seen.

original: 'on kyang de sems can rnams la chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bstan par byas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de sems can rnams la chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bstan par byas so //
translated: Nevertheless, it is taught to sentient beings as having the characteristic of non-attachment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: whatever characteristic is afflicted,

original: mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: that is a characteristic that is not a characteristic.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni; mtshan nyid kyis nye bar gnas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni; mtshan nyid kyis nye bar gnas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Affliction is not present as a characteristic.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni /
translated: The afflictions

original: phyin ci log gis nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gis nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: are based on error.

original: phyin ci log gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log gang yin pa de ni /
translated: And what is error?

original: mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of characteristics.

original: gang mtshan nyid med pa de /
analyzed: gang mtshan nyid med pa de /
translated: What is the absence of characteristics

original: tha snyad kyis kyang mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: tha snyad kyis kyang mtshan nyid med de /
translated: cannot be characterized even conventionally.

original: de mtshan nyid med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de mtshan nyid med pa kho na'o //
translated: It is simply the absence of characteristics.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: rnam par byang ba gang yin pa de yang mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba gang yin pa de yang mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: purification too is without characteristics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid kyang mtshan nyid med na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid kyang mtshan nyid med na /
translated: if the afflictions themselves are without characteristics,

original: rnam par byang ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so is purification!

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa de ni /
analyzed: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa de ni /
translated: one who understands the afflictions🔽is in accord with reality.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin te; de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ci yang med mod kyi /🔽sems can rnams ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin te; de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ci yang med mod kyi / sems can rnams ni /
translated: There are no afflictions at all,

original: phyin ci log pas kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: phyin ci log pas kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: but sentient beings are afflicted by error.

original: gang phyin ci log pa de /
analyzed: gang phyin ci log pa de /
translated: And what is error?

original: yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reality.

original: gang yang dag pa @62b ma yin pa de /🔽yang dag pa yongs su grub pa'am /
analyzed: gang yang dag pa @62b ma yin pa de / yang dag pa yongs su grub pa'am /
translated: That which is not real🔽is not the perfected nature

original: mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med do //

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

original: gang de ltar shes pa de ni /
analyzed: gang de ltar shes pa de ni /

original: rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid kyang mtshan nyid med na; rnam par byang ba lta ci smos /

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos 'di gnyis ni /

original: mtshan nyid med cing yongs su ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med cing yongs su ma grub pa'o //

original: sh'a ri'i bu; chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu; chos thams cad ni /

original: mtshan nyid med cing yongs su ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med cing yongs su ma grub pa ste /
translated: are without characteristics and unestablished.

original: de ni / chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /

original: chos thams cad chags pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: chos thams cad chags pa med pa yin na /

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad ni /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad ni /

original: chags pa med pa la chags so //
analyzed: chags pa med pa la chags so //
translated: are attached to non-attachment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni / chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de; ye shes kyi spyod yul zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni / chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de; ye shes kyi spyod yul zhes bstan to //
translated: This is the characteristic of the non-attachment of all dharmas, and is called the domain of knowledge.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: 'di ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: 'di ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul lo //

original: chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ye shes kyi spyod yul ni /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ye shes kyi spyod yul ni /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul mtha' yas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul mtha' yas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the domain of the perfection of wisdom is infinite.

original: gang chags pa med pa de'i yul dang / spyod yul mtha' yas so //
analyzed: gang chags pa med pa de'i yul dang / spyod yul mtha' yas so //
translated: The domain and the domain of activity of one who is without attachment are infinite.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: spyod yul zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: spyod yul zhes bya ba de ni /

original: spyod yul med pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: spyod yul med pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: is a synonym for the absence of a domain.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /

original: spyod yul bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: spyod yul bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phye ba ma yin no //
translated: is not distinguished by the characteristic of the teaching of a domain.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: yul zhes bya @63a *//
analyzed: yul zhes bya @63a *//
translated: What is called a domain

original: ba de ni; chos thams cad yul med pa'o //
analyzed: ba de ni; chos thams cad yul med pa'o //
translated: is the absence of a domain of all dharmas.

original: de ni / yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin pa'o //
translated: It is the suchness and the reality of all things.

original: med pa'i phyir chos thams cad yul med de /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir chos thams cad yul med de /
translated: Because they do not exist, all things are non-objects.

original: chos rnams de ltar yongs su shes pa de ni /
analyzed: chos rnams de ltar yongs su shes pa de ni /

original: yul dang / spyod yul zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yul dang / spyod yul zhes bya ste /

analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //

original: gang chos rnams de ltar yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: gang chos rnams de ltar yongs su shes pa ni /

original: gang la yang chags pa med de; chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la yang chags pa med de; chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: are not attached to anything, and this is called the characteristic of non-attachment.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is said to have the characteristic of non-attachment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di lta bu'i chos 'di la grogs mang du mi rnyed do //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i chos 'di la grogs mang du mi rnyed do //
translated: in this kind of Dharma, many companions are not found.

original: 'di lta bu'i chos 'chad pa dang / yang dag par rab tu ston pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i chos 'chad pa dang / yang dag par rab tu ston pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The explanation, the correct teaching, and the analysis of this kind of Dharma

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi yul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi yul bstan pa'o //
translated: is the demonstration of the domain of the Tathāgata’s wisdom.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: chos 'di la ni /
analyzed: chos 'di la ni /
translated: in this Dharma,

original: bden pa mthong ba'i nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa /
translated: except for the śrāvakas who have seen the truths, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are irreversible,

original: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag phyir mi ldog pa rnams ma gtogs par grogs gzhan gang yang med de /
analyzed: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag phyir mi ldog pa rnams ma gtogs par grogs gzhan gang yang med de /
translated: and the individuals who have the perfect view and are irreversible.

analyzed: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa chos 'di la spyod pa de dag kyang the tshom du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those who have the perfect view and practice this teaching will have doubts about it.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' the tshom med pa; lus mngon sum du gyur pa rnams chos 'di la bzod pa thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' the tshom med pa; lus mngon sum du gyur pa rnams chos 'di la bzod pa thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: the bodhisattvas who are free from doubt, who have actualized the body, will attain acceptance of this teaching.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni /
translated: ordinary foolish beings

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: will not.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan @63b pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan @63b pa 'di ni /
translated: this teaching of the perfection of wisdom

original: dman pa la mos pa'i sems can rnams kyi lag tu 'gro bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dman pa la mos pa'i sems can rnams kyi lag tu 'gro bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: will not fall into the hands of beings who aspire to the lesser vehicles.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di ni /
translated: this teaching of the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can gang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems can gang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa /
translated: It will come into the hands of those sentient beings who are endowed with pure roots of virtue,

original: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa de dag gi lag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa de dag gi lag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: who have served many buddhas, and who have attained the patient acceptance of dharmas that fail to be produced.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di ni /
translated: This teaching of the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
analyzed: sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
translated: will come into the hands of those sentient beings who have planted roots of virtue,

original: bsam pa dge ba /
analyzed: bsam pa dge ba /
translated: whose intentions are virtuous,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la lhag par bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la lhag par bya ba byas pa /
translated: who have served the blessed buddhas,

original: byang chub kyi phyir sa bon bskyed pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir sa bon bskyed pa /
translated: who have planted the seeds for awakening,

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhugs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhugs pa /
translated: who have entered the vehicle of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nye bar gnas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nye bar gnas pa /
translated: who are close to the blessed buddhas,

original: tshul bzhin kun 'dri ba de dag gi lag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin kun 'dri ba de dag gi lag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and who are properly inquiring.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di ni /
translated: This teaching of the perfection of wisdom

original: gang dag bzod pa thob pa dang nye bar gyur pa dang / bzod pa thob pa de dag gi lag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag bzod pa thob pa dang nye bar gyur pa dang / bzod pa thob pa de dag gi lag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will come into the hands of those who have attained patience, who are close to attaining patience, and who have attained patience.

original: gang dag lung bstan pa de dag kyang myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /🔽smon lam gyi dbang gis ni /
analyzed: gang dag lung bstan pa de dag kyang myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te / smon lam gyi dbang gis ni /
translated: Those who are predicted will quickly awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ma gtogs so //
analyzed: ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for those who are not predicted due to the power of their aspirations.

original: gang dag lung ma bstan pa de dag kyang myur du mngon sum du lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag lung ma bstan pa de dag kyang myur du mngon sum du lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are not predicted will quickly attain a prediction.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa'i rna lam du mdo sde 'di thos par gyur pa de dag kyang lung bstan pa nyid du rig par bya na /
analyzed: sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa'i rna lam du mdo sde 'di thos par gyur pa de dag kyang lung bstan pa nyid du rig par bya na /
translated: if you should know that sentient beings who have not fully ripened their roots of virtue will attain a prediction just by hearing this discourse with their ears,

original: gang mdo sde 'di rnyed pa dang / yi ger bri ba dang / 'chang ba dang / lung nod pa dang / kha ton byed @64a *//
analyzed: gang mdo sde 'di rnyed pa dang / yi ger bri ba dang / 'chang ba dang / lung nod pa dang / kha ton byed @64a *//
translated: what need is there to mention those who obtain this discourse, write it out, keep it, recite it, chant it,

original: pa dang / gzhan la yang rgya cher rab tu ston pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: pa dang / gzhan la yang rgya cher rab tu ston pa lta ci smos /
translated: and also extensively teach it to others?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa de dag gis mdo sde 'di mnyan pa dang / yi ger bri ba dang / klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa de ni /
analyzed: sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa de dag gis mdo sde 'di mnyan pa dang / yi ger bri ba dang / klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa de ni /
translated: Those sentient beings whose roots of virtue are not yet fully ripened will listen to this sutra, write it down, read it, and recite it.🔽

original: gnas med de /
analyzed: gnas med de /
translated: It is impossible that those sentient beings whose roots of virtue are not fully ripened will listen to this sūtra, write it down, read it, or recite it.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni /
translated: this Dharma discourse

original: sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bar ba rnams kyi lag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bar ba rnams kyi lag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will go into the hands of those sentient beings whose roots of virtue are blazing.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /🔽khyod mos par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu / khyod mos par bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra,🔽you should have conviction in this.

original: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: You should understand this.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa can nam /🔽nyan thos kyi theg pa can gyi rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa can nam / nyan thos kyi theg pa can gyi rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Whether they are of the Bodhisattva Vehicle🔽or of the Hearer Vehicle,

original: rigs kyi bu mo des chos 'di rnyed na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo des chos 'di rnyed na /
translated: if those sons or daughters of good family find this Dharma,

original: spro ba chung ba dang / le lo dang / gnyid che ba dang / shes bzhin med pa dang / dran pa nye bar mi 'jog pa dang / sems g-yeng ba dang / zang zing la chags pa dang / brkam pa dang / mu cor smra ba dang /
analyzed: spro ba chung ba dang / le lo dang / gnyid che ba dang / shes bzhin med pa dang / dran pa nye bar mi 'jog pa dang / sems g-yeng ba dang / zang zing la chags pa dang / brkam pa dang / mu cor smra ba dang /
translated: they will have little enthusiasm, laziness, great sleepiness, no alertness, no mindfulness, distracted minds, attachment to material things, greed, and prattle.

original: smyon thabs dang / kha phyar dang / dbang po phyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: smyon thabs dang / kha phyar dang / dbang po phyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be a madman, a braggart, or one who leaves his senses unguarded.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba byas pa dag kyang mi slu'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba byas pa dag kyang mi slu'o //
translated: he should not deceive those who have planted roots of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'di rnyed nas bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / spro ba dang / mos pa dang / le lo med pa dang / dbang po bsdams pa dang / mu cor mi smra ba rab tu bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'di rnyed nas bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / spro ba dang / mos pa dang / le lo med pa dang / dbang po bsdams pa dang / mu cor mi smra ba rab tu bsten par bya'o //
translated: Having acquired this Dharma, the bodhisattva should rely on heedfulness, diligence, enthusiasm, interest, non-laziness, restraint of the senses, and non-discursiveness.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / mang du thos pa la sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / mang du thos pa la sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: He should apply himself to the establishments of mindfulness and to learning much.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams la 'di lta bu'i yon tan 'di dag yongs su bskang ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams la 'di lta bu'i yon tan 'di dag yongs su bskang ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
translated: He should be energetic and strive to perfect such qualities.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di lta bu'i @64b chos thos pa'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i @64b chos thos pa'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: the result of hearing such a Dharma as this

original: 'di ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ma yin te /
translated: is not just this.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos 'di lta bu'i chos thos na /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos 'di lta bu'i chos thos na /
translated: For when bodhisattvas and śrāvakas hear such a Dharma as this,

original: bag byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / yid rton par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'dun pa yongs su nyams pa dang / brtson 'grus bri ba dang / ma dris pa ston pa dang / gnod sems mang du 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: bag byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / yid rton par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'dun pa yongs su nyams pa dang / brtson 'grus bri ba dang / ma dris pa ston pa dang / gnod sems mang du 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: They will not be respectful, they will not be devoted, their aspiration will decline, their diligence will diminish, they will teach without being asked, and they will have much ill will.

original: thos pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: thos pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: This is not the result of learning.🔽They have not heard such a Dharma as this.

original: de dag gis 'di lta bu'i chos 'di thos pa ma yin no; ;sh'a ri'i bu /🔽thos zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: de dag gis 'di lta bu'i chos 'di thos pa ma yin no; ;sh'a ri'i bu / thos zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: yang dag pa'i nan tan gyi tshig bla dvags te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i nan tan gyi tshig bla dvags te /
translated: ‘hearing’ is a synonym for right practice,

original: log pa'i nan tan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: log pa'i nan tan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: not for wrong practice.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: log par zhugs pas ni /
analyzed: log par zhugs pas ni /
translated: those who have entered wrongly

original: chos 'di thos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos 'di thos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not hear this Dharma.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: thos nas khyod don la mkhas shing nan tan gyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: thos nas khyod don la mkhas shing nan tan gyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: having heard it, you should be skilled in the meaning and abide in practice.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: log par zhugs pa rnams la rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa yang med do //
analyzed: log par zhugs pa rnams la rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa yang med do //
translated: those who have entered wrongly do not have the corresponding patience.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gang ji skad bstan pa'i chos 'di la log par mi sgrub pa de ni /
analyzed: gang ji skad bstan pa'i chos 'di la log par mi sgrub pa de ni /
translated: those who do not practice wrongly this Dharma that has been taught

original: chos 'di la nan tan byed ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'di la nan tan byed ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘practicing this teaching.’

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag nan tan la gnas pa dag ni /
analyzed: bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag nan tan la gnas pa dag ni /
translated: those people who are endowed with patience and who are intent on practice

original: phyir ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: phyir ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: will not go to the lower realms again.

original: myur du chos 'di yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du chos 'di yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will quickly accomplish this teaching.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ngan ngon tsam la yid brtan par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ngan ngon tsam la yid brtan par mi bya ste /
translated: Do not rely on just a little root of virtue.

original: chos 'di yongs su ma grub kyi bar du brtson pa mi gtong bas kyang yid brtan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'di yongs su ma grub kyi bar du brtson pa mi gtong bas kyang yid brtan par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not rely on not giving up striving until this teaching is fully accomplished.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gang chos 'di la bslab pa dang / yongs su grub pa dang / bzod pa thob pa de ni /
analyzed: gang chos 'di la bslab pa dang / yongs su grub pa dang / bzod pa thob pa de ni /
translated: those who train in this teaching, who fully accomplish it, and who attain patience

original: phyir ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las mi byed do //🔽de ni / phyir @65a *//
analyzed: phyir ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las mi byed do // de ni / phyir @65a *//
translated: will not do actions that lead to going to the lower realms again.🔽They will not go to the lower realms again.

original: le lo dang / 'bri ba la brten par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: le lo dang / 'bri ba la brten par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They will not rely on laziness and on being diminished.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa'i 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa'i 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they will not have the fear of turning back.

original: de lhod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lhod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be slack.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ni; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yongs su shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yongs su shes pa yin no //
translated: This is the understanding of the afflictions and purification.

original: de'i chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: de'i chos thams cad ni /
translated: All phenomena🔽are seen as they are,

original: phyin ci log las byung ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log las byung ste /

analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'o // zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba yin no //

analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa mthong ba de ni /

original: bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //

analyzed: des pa dang / tshig nyung ba dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la gnas pa dang / cho ga dang / spyod yul dang / spyod pa dang / sdom pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: They are gentle, speak little, abide in pure discipline, and are endowed with perfect conduct, domain, practice, and vows.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: sems can de lta bu la lha rnams kyang mos par 'gyur na /
analyzed: sems can de lta bu la lha rnams kyang mos par 'gyur na /
translated: if even the gods have faith in such beings,

original: mi rnams lta ci smos /
analyzed: mi rnams lta ci smos /
translated: what need is there to speak of humans?

original: sems can de lta bu la lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: sems can de lta bu la lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur na /

original: mi rnams lta ci smos /
analyzed: mi rnams lta ci smos /
translated: what need is there to speak of humans?

original: de dag gi nang du lha rnams kyang 'gro bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de dag gi nang du lha rnams kyang 'gro bar 'gyur na /

original: mi rnams lta ci smos /
analyzed: mi rnams lta ci smos /

analyzed: de dag la lha rnams kyis kyang bkur sti bya bar 'os pa yin na /

original: mi rnams lta ci smos /
analyzed: mi rnams lta ci smos /

original: de dag la lha rnams kyang srung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de dag la lha rnams kyang srung bar 'gyur na /

original: mi rnams lta ci smos /
analyzed: mi rnams lta ci smos /

analyzed: de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / nam mkha' lding dang / dri za rnams kyang de dag la srung bar 'gyur /

analyzed: de dag la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sbed pa'i phyir 'bad par 'gyur ro // dpe'i le'u zhes bya ste /

analyzed: bzhi pa'o //// @65b bam po bzhi pa /

analyzed: dag cing zab mo'i chos thos par 'dod na /
